text: On tap at La Proebition. Clear hay stack. Belgian yeast and banana. Malty and nuts.

S: wheat, malt, spices A: pale yellow, clear, firm head T: sweet, long persistent finish 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dégustée en fût au Vices & Versa en compagnie de Ju-Lo. On me propose une blanche à laspect limpide qui porte, en fût bien mal son étiquette. Je précise en fût car jai souvent bu eu loccasion de boire cette bière en bouteille et son look me semblait beaucoup moins clair. Enfin. Beaucoup darômes de muscade au nez, dépices, de coriandre en grains. Une belle quantité de pain certes, mais ce sont les épices qui dominent ici. Texture lisse en bouche. Un corps très agréable où la bulle suit la douce cadence imposée par le blé. Les épices se calment en bouche pour faire place à des fruits bien frais accompagnés dune mie de pain ménage. Ce fût ne me paraît pas conforme aux souvenirs que je me faisais de cette bière que jai souvent bu et cest la raison pour laquelle je me dois de la déguster à nouveau, un projet qui me plaît déjà.

Straw yellow hazy with unstable head.

Aroma: wheat, perfumed, spicy.
Taste: dry with light sourness.
High carbonated.
Flavour: baked apples with syrup, wheat flour, flavoured tea.

Good.

Shared BOTTLE. Cloudy pale straw, white head with so so retention. Strong sweet orange and apricot aroma,, apricot jam a tony bit of coriander. Sweet apricot, sweet white cherry and quite perfumey. Even the finish is quite sweet. Ok, but quite sweet and too perfumey.

Bière de couleur jaune paille, un blond très pâle et très effervescent qui fait dailleurs monter une mousse dont la générosité na dégale que mon envie de goûter à cette blanche que jaurais dû acheter bien avant. Nez invitant de levure belge et décorces doranges, rien qui sort de lordinaire ici. En bouche maintenant, ce que je remarque dabord est la fraicheur et la légèreté du liquide. Très rafraichissante, cette blanche offre des notes bien équilibrées de blé et de citron. Aucun défaut apparent. Savoureuse. Cheers!

Clear hazy straw peachy, almost golden color, with tons of subtle carbonation activity. Extra foamy white 3 finger head lasting around 15 minutes with some strong legs.

Faint aromas and well intensified flavors of citrus, fruits, grains, coriander, floral spices. Rich taste of sweet lemon and orange fruits coupled with a pleasant zesty sharpness and hints of clove spiciness, but slightly vinous.

Light slick body with prickly carbonation. Balanced finish ending with a sweet fruity feeling in the mouth and a slightly spicy floral feel.

Overall : Very good craft having rich pleasant flavors and an extra crispy pure freshness feel, but slightly too thin and a faint metallic smell.

Hazy yellow color with white head. Aroma is really surprising, witbier but with some very interesting spices. Makes me think of gingerbread but I dont know which spice exactly I get. Taste follows with the same notes, slightly sweet and spicy but still very refreshing. Body is medium and has a crisp carbonation. Very enjoyable, interesting and well made witbier.

(Charlevoix Dominus Vobiscum Blanche) Bottle 500 ml at home, served into a tumbler, ABV 5%
Pale yellow colour on the body, clear, with a tall but frothy white head on top, with very good retention though. Intense activity in the glass.
Aroma of wheat, spices, coriander, light citus.
Taste has lots of coriander but quite balanced, some wheat, citrus, leaves, camomile.
Medium body with good carbonation.
Witbier is not a style that I particularly like but this one was great.
Pours a hazy straw colour. Aromas of Belgian yeast, a bit of citrus and coriander. Flavours are similar with a pleasing bitter finish.

Bottle. Hazy light yellow pour with a white head, good retention. Aroma is sweet orange and lemon, slightly bready with a hint of spices. Flavour is light citrus, fairly dry with just a touch of sweetness and slightly bready. Quite a nice witbier.

500ml bottle. Hazy blonde with thin foamy white head. Flavors are wheat, pear, orange, coriander, cinnamon and cardamom with herbal and floral notes. Light to medium body, lively carbonation, smooth texture.

500ml bottle. Pours a cloudy pale yellow with a white head. Smells so goddamn good. Clove, light cinnamon, orange peel, light black pepper, light vanilla, with a definite overall ginger snap vibe going on. As for taste, very similar to the nose. Slightly watery with orange peel, cinnamon, clove, ginger, basically Bigelow Orange Spice tea in beer form which turns into MORE spice, a watery hard water note, and orange peel in the finish. I like this ALOT!

On tap at the brewpub.
Lightly hazy straw, light spicy earthy wheat light citrus and spice. Nice brew.
Tout ce qu on peut attendre dune grande wit bier avec une infusion de plante(asperule ?) Qui lui confere une enorme arome de foin seché et de tonka

Bottle 500ml. [ As Charlevoix Dominus Vobiscum Blanche ].Clear light to medium yellow color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white head. Aroma is light malty, wheat, moderate yeasty, perfume, witbier yeast, spicy, coriander. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet with a long duration, sweet perfume, sweet cinnamon, sweet coriander, spicy, yeasty. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20150116]
Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Hazy pale yellow with a white head. Aroma is sweet, wheaty, citrus and coriander. Flavor is medium sweet and light bitter. Sweet finish. 160115

Bottle, 5%. Clear pale yellow with small white head. Aroma is malt, wheat, yeast, corriander and spices. Flavour is malt, fruit, wheat, yeast, corriander, perfume, spices, medium sweet, notes ofcinnamon and a little bitter.

Pours a lightly hazed yellow and looks definitely white. It is topped by a small white head that slowly fades into a thin veil that leaves few lacing. Nose is of spices, coriander bringing citrus and cloves or maybe cardamom, feeling really fresh and authentic. Taste is of wheat and coriander, orange juice-like but with a christmas cake twist to it. For sure there is something else than coriander for spices in there! Body is light and carbonation really high and prickly. Overall a nice wit, this serie I should just revisit more often...

500 ml bottle from Peluso. Aroma: banana, lemon, orange zest, citrus, Belgian yeast, spices, chamomile. App: slightly hazy pale with medium white head. Taste and palate: light body, fizzy carbonation, light acidity finish. Overall: a really refreshing witbier. Could be a tad stronger though but enjoyed the light acidity finish.

Couleur paille, légèrement trouble avec un col blanc plus ou moins résistant. Des saveurs dagrumes, de pommes, de céréales, dépices belges dominent le tout. Les pommes apportent une certaines acidité et un petit spéciales. Une excellente blanche, une des meilleure.

Pours slightly hazy pale straw with two finger of loose white head diminishing gradually to a thick cap, moderate lacing (4/5). Nose is Belgian yeast, lemony citrus, wheat bread, apples and grapes. (8/10). Taste is mild sweet, moderate bitter, tart and spice (8/10). Light to medium body, prickly to moderate carbonation, with a spicy, tart finish (5/5).

That is nice! Glad I drank it fresh, before it had a chance to dim. Really excellent example of a true Belgian-style witbier, comparable in performance to their Lupulus as an example of Belgian Strong Ale. Tart, crisp, and almost cider-like flavour, with just a hint of cellar mustiness. Great beer for a warm day on the patio. (18/20)

Everything about this beer is aggressive. Pour is cloudy straw with a mountainous white head, even with the gentlest of pours. Nose is a lot of Belgian yeast and bread, herbal tea, banana, a bit of lemon. Taste is sweet, but balanced by a bit of tartness that makes this oddly refreshing for such a spice-heavy beer. Not my favourite style, so this is already a biased review, but one of the better examples Ive tried.
Draft at Atlantic Beer Festival Moncton. Hazy extra pale yellow color, almost clear, white edge head. Aroma is heavily spiced. Taste is heavy spice looming over clove and banana.

This is a great Witbier and stands out among others. Had a huge frothy white head with pale, unfiltered, light straw colour. Aroma was of wheat, grapes, and spices. Tasted of spices, wheat, light orange, apple, and some basement in there. Had a very smooth body with low carbonation and was kind of watery, but in a good shocking way. A real shocker of a witbier.

Pretty wackily tasty. I love coming across a style I have had a few similar beers of and then a curve ball that stills fits the style comes in the door. This had a huge frothy white head resting atop a hazy, watery-straw coloured liquid. Smells of wheat, grapes, yeast and coriander. Taste is great, spicy apple pie, light basement and some mellow citrus going on. Very smooth and surpringly low carbonation when drinking considering the beastly head.

UPDATED: NOV 28, 2014 Hazy pale yellow with a very nice white foamy head. Aroma is acid, some citrus, some spice, hint of ginger and fresh herbs with a cereal side. Taste is on the sweet side, as nearly no bitterness is present. Creamy palate with a nice medium body. Carbonation is not too high and the finish is quite pleasant!
Thank you GT2! Hazy yellow pour, small white head, aroma is citrus and herbal tea, taste is spicy with oranges, overall a really nice witbier.

2014/06/06 - Pours a hazy orange-straw colour with a thick, foamy white head that lingers. Aroma is wheat, orange, floral, yeast, cloves, cinnamon and honey. Taste is similar to nose; wheat, earthy yeast, orange, mild banana, cinnamon, spices and sweet honey malt. Mouthfeel is medium and silky with smooth carbonation and a refreshing, tart finish. Interesting and very drinkable.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle (50 cl) from bierkompass.de. Hazy pale golden with a greenish hue, large rocky white head. Doughy wheat aroma with clear notes oranges, and some other floral spices. Light to medium bodied, mmedium carbonation. Dry, low bitterness.

[ Bottle ][ 500mL ][ Marche des Saveurs Montreal ][ $5 ][ Globe ][ 6.1.14 ]
>> Clear, low haze white straw, full haze white with dregs. Giant soapy foam with good retention. Beautiful white pepper and subtle yeast nose, light esters with spiced pear, nutmeg. Taste is lightly malty, pear, white pepper, doughy and quenching. Buoyant, soft, fluffy mouthfeel. Really one of the best true witbiers Ive ever had.

UPDATED: JUN 12, 2014 pours a very pale yellow - similar to the color of ginger ale which is often a bad sign.  fluffy white head.  fruity aroma with high carbonation. very light body. tastes of melon and soft banana and some spice - maybe nutmeg or ginger. clean finish. one of the best Belgian wits I have ever had. very refreshing summer beer.

Apparence: Mousse fine avec une très bonne effervescence et de taille moyennes bulles. Dune couleur jaune paille, pratiquement clair. Surprenant, voir décevant pour une witbier.

Arômes: Agrumes très présent et épices qui masquent les céréales.

Saveurs: Saveurs moyenne dagrumes et de céréales plus faible.

Fiche technique :
Style: Witbier
Format: 500 ml
Taux dalcool : 5%
IBU: 7

Bottle from Bierkompass.de, bought in March 2014. 

A bit hazy light yellow with a small fluffy white head. Aroma of spices, coriander, some cinnamon, lime, banana and citrus. Similar taste. Quite light but refrreshing. An ok one.

wit as a genre isnt my favourite. but this.... I dont know. balanced it is not. but perhaps balance is in tje brain... youll find LOTS of spices here: coriander, pepper, cardamom, etc. intriguing, it is, drinkable... maybe. all in all: interesting. but definitely not beautifull, alas
Pine. Pudding, peach, marshmalllow. A fun flavorful witbier with good drinkablility.

Nice, full white head, falls slowly with with thick glass coating lacing. Aroma has clove, banana some wheat and spicy-earthy-mineral yeastiness. The taste mirrors the nose quite nicely, with good balance between the clove, wheat and the yeast notes. The earthiness is particularly evident in the finish, closing the beer out nicely.

Pours a half hazy yellow color with a pretty big bubbling head that stays for a pretty long time. Nose is mostly orange with some other citrus a bit of yeast. Pretty good body for the style. Somewhat sour taste but not unpleasant. Finish is citrusy. Overall its not too bad

This looks like a typically Witbier. Pours as pale yellow colour. The smell is fruity and spicy with cloves and coriander. The taste is spicy and cloves are dominants. Very refreshing and its still a complex beer if you ask me. A very drinkable Witbier. Excellent beer.
Initial citrusy, yeasty aroma. Later it sweetens and seems to have some cinnamon. Flavour has initial tart freshness but again sweetens in herbal way. Chamomile, cinnamon, gale. Strange.

500ml bottle. Cloudy, very pale, yellow-ish golden colour with average to huge, thick, frothy, fairly lasting, moderately lacing, white head. Spicy aroma, hints of orange and orange zest, coriander, chamomile, lemon, a touch of lime and lemongrass, wheaty background. Taste is intensely spicy, notes of coriander, cinnamon, orange, orange zest, lemon, chamomile, a tart touch holds a moderate sweetness of the wheaty basis at bay. Excellent Witbier with an untypical X-mas-like cinnamon touch.
Couleur blanche bien pétillante. Arome dagrumes et camomille et noisette. Couleur paille un peu cuivré. Saveur de noisette, camomille et bananes. Très Savoureuse.

Pours a cloudy lemon yellow color with a foamy head that left some nice sticky lacing. Aroma of cloves, corriander, spices, apples, lemon, orange, citrus fruits. Tasted the same, lots of flavors going on and very well balanced. Yum!

500ml bottle. Cloudy bright yellow colour, big fluffy head, lots of lacing. Spicy and citrus aroma. Coriander in the taste is well balanced, seems to fit rather than stand out. Full body but not heavy. Overall, not always a style I'm crazy about but I rather liked this one. Wish there were more like this. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

500 ml bottle. Bottled on 2012/08/01. From saveur-biere.com.
Hazy yellow colour with a huge foamy white head. 
Yeast, wheat, coriander, citrus and mild sweetness in the aroma. This is the kind of Witbier I really like... Hoegaarden style. The aroma is... wow! theres lots of spices in here... coriander and something else... Theres also wheat and yeast. That strong sweetish spice differs this quite significantly from Hoegaarden. Anyhow this is still quite enjoyable. Only a bit thin.

Évaluation no.23 Août 2010.
Couleur paille, brouillée, à bulles et à persistance moyenne.
Forte odeur dagrumes au nez. Agrumes frappants en bouche, saveur dorange et de camomille. Légèrement acide. Bien

Pours a nice clear blonde beer with a white foamy head and a nice amount of carbonation.
Smells yeast and a bit orangy. Has a fresh and positive smell overall.
Tastes refreshing and a bit spicy. 
Leaves a nice after-taste. 
I can recommend this beer. I can see myself enjoying a few of these during a summer day. Always nice for a Belgian to discover nice foreign beers like this.
Bière au goût fort en bouche. Un goût d agrume et de camomille,une bière pas comme les autres très bon résulta

Bu le 27 octobre 2013 couleur jaune voilée avec une belle mousse persistante qui produit une belle dentelle. Arôme de banane, pain et épices. Goût: désaltérante, légèrement sucré avec peu d'amertume, saveur de pain/banane. À reboire volontier!

Ketail

500 ml bottle.
Pours a golden colour with a large foamy head. Aroma of grains, lemon zest, pepper and clove. Flavour of grains, cardboard, lemon zest, clove, floral notes and a bit of bitterness. Light bodied, high carbonation and a floral, dry, grassy finish. Not a fresh bottle, unfortunately.

Bottle from Saveure-biere.com cons 2013-08-23 Göteborg
AR: yeasty, banana, coriander, orange
AP: pale coppery, foamy chemical white head 
F: yeasty, fizzy, banan, muskot, coriander, orange, watery
getting more and more boring, hollow -0,2p
On tap in Quebec City. Light body, white head. Pretty typical belgian wit sweetness and flavour. Nothing too interesting.

En bouteille. Blanche pâle voilé. Très épicé. Muscade. Coriandre. Cannelle. Girofle. Légère et Fraiche. Levure. Blé. Un peu boisé. Citronné. Banane. Je ne suis pas amateur de blanche mais c'est probablement ma favorite. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: SEP 5, 2013 Bière jaune pâle, voilée, très effervescente, surmontée dune généreuse mousse blanche immaculé. Le nez est surtout fruité, agrumes (oranges et citrons surtout) et fruits tropicaux (mangues, papayes, bananes), quelques arômes de blé, de pain et de levure également, aussi des effluves épicés et herbacés. En bouche, cest bien pétillant, mais mince au palais. Au goût, ça se démarque, cest dune complexité au-dessus de la moyenne pour une blanche. Agrumes (pas seulement orange, mais aussi pamplemousse et citron), épices (pas seulement coriandre, mais aussi muscade, gingembre, camomille), fruits tropicaux (ananas, banane), houblon floral, finale légèrement amère. À la fois légère et goûteuse, rafraichissante, digne dune excellente blanche.
de couleur dore on sens des aromes de agumes et la coriande en bouche on goute la fraicheur au gout levure avec des agrunes et la coriande bonne biere rafraichissante (rate 91)
Clear golden colored pour. Small white head with some lacing. Peppery, floral aroma with hints of wheat. Peppery floral flavor. Slight sourness. Crisp and refreshing. Not bad.

Clear golden colour, white head. Aroma of dried sausage, spicy, somewhat sour notes, light hops. Light sour wheat flavour, herbal, bay leave, spices and general wheat beer tones. Spicy finish.
Was expecting more of this one. Think they overdid it with the spices?
(From 0.5L bottle shared @ joes)

Bottle thanks to Martinus. Clear pale yellow color, small white head that leaves fair lacing. Aroma has way too much herbs and spices. Taste is the same: way way too much herbs and spices and sausage somehow. Dont like it at all actually. Not my thing at all.
Bottle @ joes thx to martinus. Hazy pale yellow colour with a small white head. Smells lots of herbs and spices. Tastes herbs and spices mostly, some malts  slightly grassy. Medium body, soft carbo.

Bouteille 500ml. De couleur dorée-jaune et voilée.  Nez épicé (coriandre), moyen de blé et de levures fruitées (agrumes) avec des notes de pain. Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen et une texture légèrement crémeuse. Goût de levures fruitées (agrumes, faibles traces de bananes sucrée) et assez épicé de (coriandre, traces de poivre et clou de girofle) lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un moyen goût de blé avec des notes de pain puis en finale lon retrouve un goût toujours épicé avec des notes de houblon herbeux. Post-goût moyen composée dun goût de levures fruitées (zeste dagrumes) et légèrement épicé avec des traces de houblon herbeux.
Une belle blanche bien pétillante, les agrumes sont plus présentes que prévu. Couleur paille un peu cuivré, avec les bananes en effluves. Savoureuse.

50cl, bottled on 8-1-2012
Dorée-foin présentant un léger trouble, col blanc.
Arôme est agréablement fleuri et citronné mais  aussi un bouquet herbacé tirant vers une note de montagne ou tisane vers la camomille.
Palais est citronné avec une pointe dépice et cannelle, pointe légèrement poivrée.
En arrive plan, je note de belles notes décorce dorange pour une fin de bouche velouteuse adoucie par la camomille. Profil garde une certaine épaisseur de grains. 
Une bière plus honorable et qui pour moi dépasse de loin certaines bières du même style que lon trouve en Belgique.
Bouteille de 500ml, robe blonde opaque, arôme de levure, goût dagrumes et de levure belge.

Bottle (500 ml). Hazy yellow with a medium diminishing white head and intense lacing. Aroma of coriander, citrus, belgian yeast and herbal tea. Taste is of orange peel, spices (coriander) and herbal tea (chamomile) with a light malt presence.  Body is medium. Lively carbonation. Great balance and extreme drinkability. My favorite Witbier!

A very good white beer, but not the best from the DV series. Smell was just a bit strange, but the spicy flavor more than made up for it. Its just not their finest product, though I still recommend it.

500ml. bottle from Peluso in MOntréal. The color is a clear honey with a thin white head. The aroma is light spicy  yeast. The taste is of fruits, herbs, spicies wheat,yeast well balanced all togerther.

6/X/2012 - 33cl bottle @ Modeste Bierfestival (Antwerpen) - BB: n/a (2012-1117) 
Clear pale yellow beer, big aery white head, bit stable, non adhesive. Aroma: flowery, bit sweet, wild sour touch, yeast, wheat? MF: ok carbon, light to medimu body. Taste: bit sour, wheaty, grains, floral, pretty flat. Aftertaste: little sour, slightly soapy bitterness, floral, sweet, yeasty. Pack it up guys, back to Canada with you... (tasted at a Belgian beer festival, together with the Brut and the RyePA)
Definitly a good witbier. Blond yellow colour, a lot of carbonation. Nose of smoked meat? Citrus, banana and herbs. Very complex.

Bottle sampled @ Modeste 2012 - hazy orange with a whit head - nose is rich in lemon peel, lemon juice, light coriander - nice bit sweeter, fruitier, take on the style - distinctly belgian in style for me - my friend remarked that you can instantly pick up that this is not a Belgian beer - huge lemony citrus taste, coriander, cloves, herbs, lightly soapy, herbal back, orange peel, light wheat - higher carb accompanied expected lighter feeling body - very good within style
Bottle. Pours gold with white head. Nose/taste of coriander, wheat malt, banana, spicy malt and herbs. Lots of spice and and coriander. Medium body. Finishes spicy/herbs.

Really easy to drink brew with a nice spiced cinammon and clove blend. The pour is a bright yellowish gold with a thick foamy white head that leaves blotches of lacing. The nose is well spiced up with the typical Belgian wit yeast and esters with a light wheat malt. Very crisp and refreshing brew with a nice spice kick andflavorful yeast. Overall, well done

Une blanche couleur paille, voilée, mousse fine qui colle au verre. On sent les agrumes, mais aussi la banane.  En bouche, faibles notes dagrumes (lime), mince en bouche, très effervescente, faible amertume en post-goût.
Sampled at the GCBF. Lemon & orange on the nose. Hazy with little carbonation. Easy downer. Pleasant dry finish, almost like tonic water.
Beau colet de mousse et dun jaune trouble. Mince en bouche, lagrume et le citron sont présents. Une note de banane. Complexe et désaltérante. Larrière-goût est peu présent.  Légèrement acide.

50 cl bottle, Mulmur, ON, Canada via LCBO. Slightly hazy pale yellow colour, thick foamy head. Aroma of spiced bubblegum and banana. Smooth, then a floral hop spiciness that finishes with vanilla and ginger.

Pepper
Pint at Bateau de Nuit. Wickedly cloudy golden yellow with superb capage. First smell is peppery lemon, with banana. Yeasty goodness. Taste is so smooth. Exceptionally easy drinking. Coriander, yeast, citrus. I can't wait for how good my dink will feel as this passes back out. Had this in bottle before but it's a treat to have on tap.

Sample on tap at Saint-Pub (Baie Saint-Paul). Pours crystal clear blonde. Aroma: nice fresh aroma of orange, coriander and lavander. Taste: yeast, orange, citrus. God blance of sweet and slight bitterness. Good bodied, especially for a white beer. Good carbonation. Refreshing and drinkable.

I really enjoyed this, especially for a style I dont usually like. Quite a hoppy profile. Taste is quite bitter for a white. Pours with good lacing and long-lasting head. Cloudy blond. Theres a little yeast but hop profile owns this one. Great. On tap at volos.

Draft to 8oz taster. 
Sweet hay aroma with a touch of citrus. Pours a clear pale yellow with a thin white head and it has a slight cloudiness. A nice clean refreshing taste with hay, breadiness, Belgian yeasts, banana and maybe lemon.

(500mL bottle from LCBO. aged ~10 months) Pours a pale straw yellow-gold, with 1.5" of bubbly white head that recedes without lacing. Aroma of pale grain, citrus zest, coriander and other floral spice, musty yeast. Taste typical of light wheat malts, lemon zest, pears, coriander, light pepper and spice, tart barnyard funk note on the finish, quite dry, Mouthfeel fairly light as expected for the style, a tick watery, carbonated heavily with a feel a little too soda-pop rather than champagne. Good wit, not the best.

Verse un liquide doré avec un léger col blanc laissant quelques dentelles sur les parois du verre. Nez de malt, corriandre, bananes et citrons. En bouche, elle regore de fraicheur: corriandre, citrons et un soupçon de muscade. Très bon produit, complexe et équilibré.

500ml bottle. Pale hazy yellow, as you would expect from a wheat beer. Big fluffy white head with decent retention and some nice lacing. Magnificent aroma: banana, yeast, apricot, lemon zest, vanila, some flowers. Unusual taste with lots of coriander, pear, basil, lemon, and again floral. Lots of carbonation. Very good.

Pours a slightly hazy yellow gold color.  Great head with minimal lacing.  Crisp aromas of straw, orange peel and a hint of peppery spice.  The flavor is bright with lots of bottom rising bubbles delivering flavors very similar to the aromas but with a nice balanced clean finish that has a hint of sourness !

500ml brown bottle. Yellow colour, hazy, big white head that is airy and foamy. Good glass coating lace. Sweet nose, orange peels, lemons, honey, floral, spicy. Taste is floral, sweet and spicy, trace lemon and tea, herbal. Dry and wheaty finish with some yeast notes. Light body and average carbonation. Overall this just didnt come together for me, had some good elements but as a whole I found it hard to drink.

Bière blonde voilée, digne dune vraie blanche, surmontée dune mousse uniforme. Des arômes timides, néanmoins agréables, de levures et dagrumes, accompagnées dodeurs champêtres. Un goût intéressant dépices et encore ici, dagrumes, donnant cette touche acidulée, qui à son tour est assez faible. Je trouve quelle manque un peu de personnalité. Embouteillée le 22-09-11. (182-100312)

Jaune, brumeuse, jolie mousse éphémère.  Odeur épicé et citroné.  Au goput elle est fraîche, légèrement acide, plus sucré que la plupart des witbier que jai bu, on goûte de lorange.  Un peu pétillante.

Bottle 500ml.

Pours blond, with nice white head, some lacing. Good carbonation. Aroma is of citrus and spices. Tastes citrus, spices. Some acidity, very refreshing. A quality witbier.

500ml  bottle pours a light golden color with a 2 finger white head and some thin lacing on the glass.  Aroma is cereal grains with hints of yeast and coriander spice.  Taste is malty sweet with some fruitiness and a bit of yeast and a mild hoppy bitter finish.  Light to medium body and decent carbonation provide a nice mouthfeel.  This is a really pleasing white ale that was a pleasure to have sampled.
Pours clear and pale yellow with very thick white head.  Very carbonated.  Initial aroma is of banana, wheat.  The taste begins the same and quickly dissipates into the brewed spices.

On tap at brewpub. Pours a nice straw, yellow with a thin veil. Nice white head, however quickly dissolves. Smells of citrus. Taste is of orange, sweet grapefruit, spices, mainly coriander. Slight acidity in the finish, very little if any bitterness. Medium body, high carbonation. Quite possibly my favorite white beer.

Refrigerate bottle complements of pushkinwow poured into a weizen glass.  Pours bright hazy yellow with fairly big head that dies down some, medium body, and highly carbonated.  Taste is wheat, spicy yeast, and coriander.  This is great.
Brewed with spices is right. Hints of nutmeg, cinnamon & vanilla. Intense bubbly activity on the palate.  If poured correctly with a straight pour it will yield a nice creamy head of some longevity.
Bière de type belgian white de 5% dalcool, mousseuse, peu dagrumes, dégusté à la brasserie.

bottle from ferme guyon A: coriander, citrusy, orange peel, camomille on the finish. App: clear blond giant lasting white head T/P: body is on the light side finish is light sour. High carbonation. O: Excellent probably the best wit available in Quebec. The spiciness is great.

500ml bottle. Puts a clouded gold ale in the tumbler with a small white cap that reduces quickly (disappointing). Lots of carbonation. Aroma is citrusy, wheaty, spices-coriander, cardamom, light funk from the Belgian yeast. Light dry demeanor, refreshing, spicy, lemony dry clean finish. Body a tad thin but a serviceable witbier just the same.

500ml bottle, 5% a/v

Pours a light grassy yellow colour with some haze, nice white head. Aroma is banana, grass, and a bit of spice. The taste is fairly light, spicy banana wheat goodness. A pretty refreshing beer with a slightly watery palate, pretty good though!

Very light yellow/straw colour.  Slightly hazy.  Mountains of white head.  Aroma: lots.  Lots of clove, orange, banana, lemon, yeasty pepper.  Crisp palate, brisk sourness, lively peppery, slightly astringent finish.

500 mL bottle from the LCBO courtesy of Rob & Pat, served in a tulip. Pours hazy golden with a tall, fluffy white head. The head remains and leaves a small amount of fine lace. On the nose, there are spicy notes of nutmeg, and ginger along with lemon, citrus, grass and a hint of flowers. The flavour is moderately sweet with a moderate spicy character. Wheat comes through nicely, along with chamomile and the spicy notes from the aroma. The finish is long and dry with plenty of chamomile. On the palate, it is medium in body with a smooth, milky texture and average carbonation. Overall, this is a very nice spicy witbier. The chamomile is a nice touch, coming through surprisingly clearly in the finish. Very well put together. The spice is a bit too strong for my taste, but it is still an excellent brew. 2011-09-22
This is some kind of beer! First its beautiful. Very nice hazy yellowish color with medium white head. Then the taste. Sublime! So many nice flavours, youd think you died and go to heaven!
(bottle) hazy pale yellow with small white head; aroma of spices, fruit; flavour of spices; tasty and flavourful

pours cloudy yellowish-white, small head, micro-carbonation, minimal lacing. Strong lemony-citrus notes (lemon meringue, lemon curds), hint of chamomile (as advertised), but rather short length. Medium complexity, low-medium depth, thin-bodied on the edges, and flavours tend to go straight down the middle. A bit of malty back-end, mildly sour and tangy, and carbonation holds the flavours well. Still, well-flavoured but lacking in length: watery finish.
bottle. Pours orange-white cloudy, large head, tons of bubbles. Aroma is citrus, spice, yeast, bananas. The taste is very spicy, but still light. Quite bubbly. A very interesting wit.
500 ml bottle. Poured slightly clear with notes of bubblegum and spices in the aroma and taste.

Appearance: Light yellow, cloudy with a medium snow white head. Aroma: Spicy, yeast, nutmeg, floral and lemony. Lovely aroma! Flavour: Wow! Delicious vanilla yeast, lemon, spice, pepper, shortbread, just so refreshing. Probably one of the best wits Ive ever had. Wow,

The whitest wit I have ever seen.  Very pale golden pour with a lot of carbonation and thick white head.  Very strong citrus scent, exactly what I expect from the style.  Very strong mixed and spicy taste.  Spicy as in mixed spices not as in "hot"   My only compliant is a high level of carbonation, almost champagne like.  I havent worded it well enough yet, but man I am loving this.  I love wits during the summer and this is one of the best wits I have had.  This is amazing.

Bottle; hazy pale yellow with medium white head; aroma- spice, corriander, yeast, herbal tea; taste-medium sourness, lightly bitter, almost no carbonation or sweetness. Interesting but not my cup of tea. Very intense aroma. Too tart. I can definitely appreciate the hard work behind this craft
Bottle, pours a bright yellow, taste and smell are both very spicy. Really light and very easy to drink, good offering
wheaty aroma with some banana and bubblegum. flavour was the same with spices. this beer was kind of hidden behind all the spices they use, the spices were okay but a little overpowering.

Never been a belgian white kinda guy. But this stuff, this stuff has game. 
Pours a hazy yellow with a fizzy short lived white head. The aroma spice, yeast, banana, bazooka joe bubble gum, and chalk. Awesome. The flavour is sweet banana notes on the edges of my tongue, yeast and spice down the middle, and a lemon/yeast/spice/chalk on the back of my tongue and into the finish. EPIC. Best White Ever.

Pour hazy yellow big pillowy white head. Aroma clove, bubble gum, banana, spice, coriander, chamomile. Taste vanilla, coriander, bubble gum, banana, clove, spice, wheat, chamomile. MF medium/full body nice light carb. Extremely tasty well brewed with some great edgy tastes.
bottle at Volo, Toronto. cloudy light straw yellow. citrusy, lemon zest, floral, pot pourri, chamomile. strange nutmeg, cinnamon taste in the finish that was unique & added something neat. Nice wit

Delightfully spiced for a belgian white. Not much head, pale in colour. Flavours of banana and pepper interact very well. The alcohol could be felt, but then again I had it almost at room temperature and even then it was terrific.

500 ml bottle - pours a beautiful opaque glowing creamed honey colour with a billowy bone-white head.  Gorgeous aroma: clove, nutmeg, white pepper, leather.  Flavour has the same without the tart cloying lemony quality that can mar wit/weiss styles, IMO.  Light, snappy, perky, complex.  Everything you could want in a wit.  Absolutely top notch.

500 ml bottle from LCBO.  Pours a cloudy pale golden yellow with lots of little bubbles in the body, a few floaties and a large soapy white head.  Aroma is banana, citrus, wheat with a light spiciness.  Flavour is wheaty and quite yeasty with banana, citrus and some spiciness.  Lightly dry finish.  Tasty.

on tap at brewpub. very pale yellow, slight haze, with a decent white head. spicy - coriander, with a smooth floral camomile touch. some malts and wheat, although structure is suffering a little. light body, average carbonation. quenching and nice. would be happy to have it from a bottle.
500ml bottle fromthe lcbo. hazed golden with abig white head. citrus and wheat nose. straight forward wit but dryer then most. well constructed. enjoyable butto expensive to drink in quantity.

500ml bottle 
5.0% ABV 
I tried this beer on June 29, 2011 after purchasing from one of my local LCBO outlets.  The beer poured a cloudy golden yellow with a generous white cap that quicky faded into a surface film.  The aroma was wheat malt, light fruit, and floral hops.  The mouthfeel was medium bodied with medium carbonation.  The flavour was wheat malt, coriander, citrus and had a slight bitter finish.  An extremely well done witbier!
Poured from 500ml bottle. Straw coloured and cloudy. Large white head. Flavours of lemon and spices, crisp finish. Great example of a wit beer!!

500ml bottle. Hazy pale straw yellow with a white head. Very light aroma - wheat, yeast, some hops, bit of citrus. High carbonation - bubbly in the mouth, starts sweet then mellows a bit with a bite of bitterness on the end that disappears quickly. Very smooth but its either not clean enough or not complex enough - as a result suffers from being somewhere in between.

Bière trouble couleur de blé, coiffée dun large col blanc, mais éphémère.  Des arômes de citron et de giroffle.  Plutôt acide.  Plutôt légère et mince, elle offre une effervescence vive et une fin arômatique et acide.
La meilleure blanche belgeque jai bu. Bien que pas fan du style, ses arômes dépices et dorange combiné à une légère amertume et une sécheresse en bouche et en finale on su me satisfaire.
500 ml bottle.  Pours bright straw in colour, slightly hazy, with huge frothy white head.  Aroma and taste are classic wit - spicy, yeasty.

Pours a hazy yellow gold with massive white head that vanished almost instantly. Aroma is very spicy, pepper, clove, ginger, yeast and some hops. Mouthfeel is extremely carbonated. Taste is very clove laden, some lemon, gum, yeast, moderate spice (ginger), sharp hops. Finish is tongue tingling, probably the carbonation...but the underlying flavours are still decent.
Bouteille 500 mL - Arômes de pain dépices avec une certaine fraicheur. Le corps est très léger et se laisse boire à grandes gorgées. Goût de pain dépices, doranges avec une finale légèrement sûre.

A lot of floral and wheat in the nose, some % hiding in there too. Great head n lacing, it did turn out hazy cuz i spun the bottle like a wheat beer! I like it to be a bit chewy. A bit red too. The malts are on your toung with sweetness and some grain taste. This is quite a yeasty beer. The flavours hang on after its gone and warm the mouth a touch. Pretty good wit, % is just noticable.

UPDATED: APR 5, 2011 This beer pours clear but thick orange with a white hue and bubbly white head. The aroma is a bit crisp, sweet, like a spring morning - herbal and floral, but very soft. The flavor is delicious for my first favorite style from back in the day - the Belgian Wit. It starts out sweet with soft breadiness, and then gets herby with a lightly spicy smooth medium body. Overall this is delicious! On the rerate in a much fresher version, lots of tangy and sweet and sour flavors hit big on the palate.
Beautiful citrus aroma. Refreshing taste typical of variety. Lively carbonation. Overall standout from a fabulous brewery. Bravo!

Nice foggy yellow-orange body with a good solid white head on top. Aroma is like a key lime pie; very citrusy but also coming off as very tasty. Taste is strong citrus notes with a slight witbier hint; carbonation is a little too aggressive. But, other than that, this stuff is good.

Bière blanche de 5 %. On la décrit comme une bière de blé épicée. Jai trouvé cette bière très salée, ce que je ne connaissais pas dune blanche. Un peu de goût citronné, mais pas le goût habituel dagrumes. Long col au versement. À boire très froide.

This blanche beer was part of the 4 beer package that i bought. Im not a big fan of blanches, but this one does not dissapoint. I dont really have to describe a classic blanche beer, but lets just say that this one was a enjoyable one, every component beign well balanced for a refreshing - yet tasty - experience.

bottle from cfrancis for secret santa 2k10.  Pours a hazed creamy yellow with a big, long lasting white foamy head.   Aroma of herbal wheat, prickly lemonzest, fresh cut grass, and cloves.   taste is sweet, doughy, fresh, hearbal wheat. leaves a long lasting musty, sweet dough, and pungent herb note on the tongue.   dry.  clean.   very well made.   surely the best ive had of the style.   great beer!

Hazy golden colour with a frothy white dissipating head and lace. Spice and herbs in the aroma. Hints of citrus, ginger and lemon-grass. Sweet bitter texture. Rich flavour of spices. Slight hint of citrus which gives the beer a sourness. Refreshing beer, better than expected.

500ml bottle. pours a cloudy yellow with a thin white head that seems to last forever and leaves nice lacing. aroma is fresh coriander, lemons and oranges, and lots of spices. flavour is loaded with citrus, coriander and cloves. mouthfeel is light but not too light, and very effervescent. this has to be the most flavourful witbier i have ever had. this high rating is a result of this beers excellence within its style.

500 ml bottle. pours beige to yellow  in colour . It is almost completely white! Hazy and having great carbonation. aromas are awe inspiring. textbook mix of cloves/nutmeg, belgian esters, fruity lemon notes, some banana and oragne rind! amazing. it is a well balanced brew on the palate. good mix of sour notes and belgian esters, again, with some banana and fruit notes. I think it is less expressive on the palate then its aromas led me to beleive. It is a really interesting brew to say the least!

500ml Bottle 5%alc./vol.  Thick white head resting above a very pale colored brew. Aromas of citrus & green apple. On the pallet I get candied orange, yeast and a slight sweetness that fades to a lemon/yeast after taste. I really enjoyed this beer. Highly recommended for a hot day!
500mL bottle, pours cloudy light yellow with a white head. Aroma of citrus, orange peel, and yeast. Flavour of yeast, spices, coriander, citrus and orange peel - a little tartness.

50cl bottle, thanks Lubiere.  Large white head that mostly dissipates atop cloudy light amber body.  Aroma is moderately sweet, orange, lemon, clove, some coriander.  Taste is medium sweet, lemon, some banana, light clove.  Fairly effervescent light-medium body.
Bouteille 500 ml. 5%. Couleur jaune paille un peu brouillée. Mousse blanche. Arôme dagrumes, herbes et épices. Goût de blé, de levures et agrumes. Bonne

500ml bottle. Seaport Beer Fest. Pours hazy yellow with a big pillowy head and leaves a huge amount of lace. Very spicy on the nose with lots of citrus underneath. Same in the mouth. Wickedly complex.
Very complex, spicy aroma: gingerbread, baking spices.  Flavor is similarly spicy, but not totally dominated - more ginger, nutmeg, clove.  Delicious.  Light yet full of character.

Le liquide est jaune pâle.  La mousse est blanche, solide et tenace.  Traces collantes aux parois du verre.  Le nez est fascinant : de la camomille, des biscuits, du thé, de la levure, des épices, de la vanille, du blé et quelques agrumes juteux.  Au goût, très semblable avec le retour de la camomille en premier plan, des épices et du miel en milieu de parcours et du blé et des notes acidulées en fin de course.  Le liquide est de moyenne corpulence, libère une quantité normale de bulles et possède une texture crémeuse.  La finale est courte et sèche sur des saveurs fraîches de banane, de citron et dépices.  En résumé, le brasseur propose une blanche audacieuse et complexe.

This Charlevoix region witbier pours a cloudy golden colour with a big white fluffy head that stays forever (well, almost) and leaves great patchy-chunky lace. Lots of carbonation. Very nice spicy nose at first pour, then the Begian white beer yeast appears and the aromas soften. The oranges are then felt. Average watery mouthfeel with a very mild tart. Refreshing wheat taste with a lemon twist and the yeast present again. I do feel a touch of maple in the aroma and taste too. A pretty good witbier, from a great micro that has a very nice brewpub.

pours hazy golden with a nice white head and some spotty lacing.  aroma is sweet consisting of vanilla, chamomile and citrus.  The mouthfeel is pleasantly sparkling with flavors of vanilla, herbs and orange.  finishes dry.

Pours a clear, straw yellow colour with a big frothy white head. The aroma is predominately of herbs and spice, but there is also some hops and citrus fruits; lemon and orange. The taste is again filled with herb and spice, quite smooth. Light body, little carbonation but easy to drink. Decent brew.

Bottle.  Better than most of the white beers I had, citrusy, spicy, fruits from yeast and just a little dry.  Not much IBU (7...) but still has a discreet and enjoyable hoppy twist.  Really enjoyable stuff, especially for a white beer, a style Id avoid less frequently if they were all this good!

Bottle @Volo for the Biere et Compagnie.

Aroma is a spicy wheat, and  lemon zest, almost clear yellow, pours a small firm, long lasting white head. Flavour is spice dominated, then wheat, citrus, and some very fine malt. Light bodied, extremely well balanced, lovely mouthfeel. Terrific!

Bottle. Pours cloudy pale amber, nice head, passable lacing. Nose is wheat, yeast spice and wait... pumpkin?!? Why does this smell exactly like canned pumpkin pie filling? Palate is again pretty typical witbier, until a great huge pumpkin-bomb rolls on through and devastates any wit characteristics. This is odd, not entirely unpleasant (really, who doesnt like pumpkin pie), but very very odd.

Pours a cloudy light orange with a nice white head. Aromas or orange peel, coriander, bananas. Very sweet smelling. Some spice aromas as well.  Very strange flavors. Some very mild orange, coriander, and honey. Lots of floral notes. Very very light flavor. Almost like drinking a cloud. Very soft. Proper bitterness to add some body. Good summer beer.

Cloudy white colour with a slightly pink hugh when held to natural light. Tall foamy head. Great carbonation. Aroma has a very spicy clove aroma, with slight notes of wheat. Flavour is more like gingerbread. lots of clove and fruit. Banana in the finish. A very spicy beer. Rich and complex. I like it.

Bottle. Pours a bright golden with cloudy sediment, generating a dense white head that collapses into little islands in my Guillotine glass. Beautiful aroma of wheat, lemonpeel, coriander, jasmine flowers, and spice (no cinnamon for me though, unlike some other raters). Palate is light and lively, wheaty, softly yeasty, with nice floral lemony flavours and sweet spices. Finish is slightly tart. A standout wit. Fantastic!
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Big fan of Charlevoix.  And this did not disappoint.  Cloudy straw yellow colour.  Aroma is wheat, yeast, lemon and cinnamon.  Taste again is wheat, lemon and cinnamon.  Palate is tickled very nicely.  Overall, this a great white, recommended.

Pours a hazy yellow with a large rocky white head. The aroma has a tun of coriander... Almost too much. Also on the nose; apple, lemon, yeast, cloves, and wheat. The palate finds a little more balance. Lemon, cinnamon, apple, clove, coriander, bready yeast, and banana. nice lively mouth feel. Not bad at all.
Pours bright gold into a tumbler. Bright white head with good retention slowly recedes to skim surface. Lemon and wheat aromas. Light and dry with corriander and wheat from front to back. Refreshing.

UPDATED: OCT 8, 2009 Murky yellow almost amber pour strange color for a white. Aroma: apple, lemon & cinnamon buns all the way. Taste: keeps the apple cinnamon with a bit of yeast nice full mouthfeel with a medium lasting finish (of tart apple). Awesome whitbier.
Bottle.  Powerful aroma of pumpkin, cordiandor?  Very nice, spicy and flavorful.  Beautiful finish.  Very enjoyable.

golden pour, frothy white head. Aroma if LOADED with wheat, lemon, and corriander. The flavor is also loaded with lemon, and corriander, wow, this is excellent. The flavor is so fresh, and crips, and refreshing. The lemon is so zesty, and bright. awesome!
Color is yellow and hazy with a decent white head. Aroma is of coriander, perfume, lemon zest and ginger. Taste is of lemon, coriander, banana and ginger. High carbonation.

500mL bottle thanks to Dany!  Poured slightly hazy brighter golden with a fluffy, sticky cap of white head.  The aroma picked up dry toasted banana with white pepper and floral accents.. more spicage as it warmed up along with a touch of honey.. very well balanced.  The flavor had honey and bready notes at the core laced with toasty bananas.. floral notes and dry spices graced the edges and stuck on the sweet, rather long finish.  Medium-bodied or slightly less on the palate with fuller carbonation and tanginess from the esters.. drier on the back-end.. tasty!

Dégusté dans un verre du mondial de la bière. De couleur miel ambré ayant une bonne mousse et des bulles moyenne. Au nez la coriande,le caramel, le pain, la banane et la pelure dorange se convoitent. Dune faible amertume quand même persistante et bien gazéfier, une excellence au palais. Goût de levure de pain, de coriande et de pelure dorange, un bel équilibre.

Bought from Terroir in Montreal.  Pours pale gold with a large frothy-white head.  Aroma of yeast and spices.  Flavor was initially quite mild, but soon revealed accents of clove, coriander, grains of paradise, and other spices (leaning more herbal).  Beyond the spicy notes, there was a mild sweetness but little else.  Finish was medium in length, with yeasty flavors.  Overall, this brew continues my hunch that Charlevoix can really craft some complex, subtly-flavored Belgian beers.  However, Blanche in my opinion fails to fully please the palate due to a lack of firm flavor, too often dissolving into an array of herbal spice.
Bonne blanche avec le gout épicé (coriandre) particulier des bières de charlevoix.  Se boit très bien.  Gout de citron, banane et autres fruits.  Agréable sensation en bouche, plus que correct.

500mL bottle purchased for $4 - I think it was at Marche Joanette in Montreal back in February, so perhaps not as fresh as should be for a wheat beer.  Pours a cloudy white with a fizzy fluffy head.  Decent aroma of the light Belgian wit variety - coriander and the like.  The first gulp is very quenching - light and sparkly on the tongue and very much to the Belgian wit style.  Spices in the aftertaste.  A little too light-bodied - but yet again, that’s the style, innit?

500mL bottle. Pours your typical nice looking Wit with a huge white, fluffy head. Aroma is, once again, your a-typical Wit, the usual suspects, lots of yeasty goodness, a touch of soap. But the flavour in this one is really where it shines. Great wheaty malty notes the whole way through, typical corriander, but with a sharp bite of something else, some other spice in the finish, that makes it even more tasty and sets it apart from a lot of other Wits Ive had. Curacao? Just more corriander? Very floral. A little soapy, but not in an off way. Definitely not clove, something surely is different, but in a good way. Decent bubblegum flavour too, something I usually like but find absent in a lot of examples of this style. A top notch Belgian Wit, and something that really htis the spot nicely on such a hot and humid day.
Smell is lightly fruity, flowers, banana, missing something. Some alcohol.  Straw yellow color with a light head.  Carbonation.  Banana in the taste, light, needs something else to complete.

UPDATED: FEB 4, 2009 Bouteille de 500 ml. LA bière se présente avec une robe paille-dorée légèrement voilée et une mousse qui couvre parfaitement le liquide du début à la fin. Notre nez découvre un parfum de fleur, de coriandre, dagrumes, de banane, de poire, de jujubes et de levure.   En bouche le corps est mince-moyen avec une texture pétillante. Nos papilles gustatives font connaissance avec des flaveurs de citron, de blé, de levure, de banane, de pêche, de mangue avec une légère touche poivrée.
Bottle. Body-Thin dark yellow with a foamy head. Nose-big time chamomile, lotion, spicy wit yeast. Taste-shrimp, thin, birthday cake, sea water, GINGER, Sprite, lemon/lime. A decent enough wit.

Light hazing and pale yellow with decent head retnetion. Aroma is weaty with a small amount of coriander and lemon. Flavour is thinner with some wheaty banana and a touch of spice.  Not a lot of body to this one.
(500ml bottle)  Pours a cloudy pale yellow body with a small white head.  Aroma of coriander, lemon zest, clove, ginger, and banana.  Flavor of lemon, yeast, coriander, and banana.  A tasty witbier!

500 ml bottle from Trappe a Fromage, served at cellar temperature in a tulip glass.
App.:  Bright yellow, hazy, large white meringue.
  
Aroma:  Lots o fyeast and dough, pleasant but somewhat overbearing spices  coriander, nutmeg and ginger, maybe a little clove?, light apple/peach, a bit of lemon.
  
Palate:  Medium-light body and moderate effervescence.
  
Flav.:  Less yeast/dough than the nose, lemony, lots of coriander, some ginger/nutmeg, a big of light cereal and vanilla; on swallowing, the yeast/dough prevails but gives way to a soft lemon-cereal finish; a touch of tartness, refreshing. 

A pretty tasty little summer beer marred by excessive spices.

Bottle, thanks to Bu11zeye.
Pours a hazy straw color with medium white head. Aroma of hop citris. Flavor of bannana, coriander, lavender, and slight ginger. Champaign-like mouthfeel.
Not a bad beer, not great either...seems like they could have done a slightly better job on this.....

Bottle.  Cloudy golden poor with a nice small off white head.  Aromas of bubble gum, coriander, peppermint, salty and spruce.  Nicely effervescent, nicely sweet ... lacking a little body though.  Flavors are fruity (wildberries), spruce, light mint, tart and salty...

500 mL bottle.  Golden, with just a hint of orange, and a nice fluffy white head.  Lots of coriander in the aroma, along with sweet orange and a touch of pepper.  The flavour turns down the orange a bit, and dials up the spice, especially the black pepper.  Add a little yeast in there as well.  Medium body, nicely carbonated.  An excellent summer beer.

Bouteille brune de 500 ml. Nez dagrumes et de coriandre. Robe paille, très peu de mousse. Goût dagrumes et dépices, avec un soupçon de sucre. Très léger arrière-goût de houblon. Globalement une bonne blanche.

bouteille brune de 500ml.

belle couleur jaunâtre, un peu trouble. la mousse trône sur cette bière, elle est épaisse et durable. le nez soffre avec des touches classiques de blé, avec un un peu dépices. en bouche elle est fraiche, elle a une belle longueur. finale agréable et citronnée.

En fût. Verre de dégustation au Saint-Pub (Baie-St-Paul, QC). Arôme: Odeur de coriandre et dagrumes. Apparence: La couleur est blanchâtre pâle très légèrement voilée avec une très faible densité de bulle. Présence dun mince col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de coriandre et de citron. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement minérale. Faible effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût légèrement citroné. (Rating #1303)

UPDATED: JAN 12, 2009 [408-20070708] Bottle (c/o tuqueboy, w/ him, jerc). Very wheaty aroma with some apricot notes. Hazy, light yellow body with a long-lasting foamy off-white head. Very wheaty flavour has a mild fruit background. Medium body. Nicely wheaty. (7/4/7/3/14) 3.5

[1767B-20081004] Bottle. Lemon yeastiness and a bit of grass in the aroma. Hazy, light orange brown body with a long-lasting creamy white head. Lots of Belgian yeast and citrus flavour. Medium body. Very nice, yeasty and strong. (7/4/8/3/15) 3.7

Bouteille. Couleur jaune-légèrement orangée voilée. Mousse mince qui reste bien. Arôme très épicé, très coriandre, levure, blé. Goût aussi très coriandre, poivré, agrumes, levures, le blé est faible. Corps moyen, effervescence moyenne. Bonne, mais trop épicée pour moi.
UPDATED: DEC 16, 2007 500ml bottle. Hazy straw with a thin but long lasting white head. Aroma is spicy, herbal and citrusy. Taste is also very citrusy and spicy, not as strong as the aroma though.
Je mexcuse, mais je naime pas cette bière.  Je trouve quelle goûte le savon.  Un beau col, une belle dentelle, mais acre et ce goût prononcé que je décrivais.  Désolé.

Bottle courtesy of Hogtown Harry, who doubled up on his mission to trade for and purchase every Quebec beer ever made.  Nice medium yellow, a few streaming bubbles, nice compact tight white head, long lasting.  Aroma - ohhh, very strong!  Tons of spice (coriander), pepper, and wheat - wonderful stuff!  Taste - wow, once again, coriander and pepper dominate at first, and then there is appreciable hop bitterness and a lovely citrus character to the wheat malt body.  Very active and tingly in the mouth.  Roof of your mouth lemon.  Finishes way too quickly though, only complaint.  Serve this in a proper glass on tap on a patio on a warm day and Im driving there now, what a great surprise, thanks again Harry.

Brown bottle, 500 ml; eye: oraney, nice effervescence, clear, off-white head that resembles champagne but eventually disappears completely; nose: total domination of the coriander, yeast, bread; mouth: coriander towers above everything else, yeast, bread, fizzy, finale in coriander with a hint of yeast, lightly bitter and astringent, medium body, rather thin; overall: enjoyed

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille brune, 500 ml; oeil : orangée, belle effervescence, claire, mousse blanc cassé faisant penser à du champagne et qui éventuellement disparaît complètement; nez : dominance de la coriandre, levure, pain; bouche : coriandre qui domine, levure, pain, pétillante, finale en coriandre avec une pointe de levure, légèrement amère et astringente, corps moyen, texture plutôt mince; en résumé : bien aimé

Hazy yellow honey hue, with an off-white head, fruity notes of citrus fruits, orange peels, spicy coriander, yeasty aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a yeasty acidic citrus fruits character, with a candied pineapple accent, wheat malt note, orange peels and spicy coriander wedding, a lactic trouch, leading towards a juicy citrusy finish.

UPDATED: JUL 13, 2010 500ml bottle.  Cloudy yellow-golden body with a medium white head.  Coriander nose.  Taste is dominated by an excessive amount of coriander under which exists some fruity yeast, citrus & lemon.  Far from a watery witbier this one has a rich body.  Short and dry finish with a pleasant astringency.  Not up to par with the other Dominus Vobiscum but Im pretty sure Ive had better bottles in the (Ill have to try the next batch).  Thats the problem with Microbrasserie Charlevoix, its one of my favourite micro but from batch to batch their beers are as unpredictable as my cousin Louis on acid.

Huge head impressive carbonation, good retension and laces. Golden/yellow hazy color. Nose is probably its best attribute: lemon, esters (banana), yeast and coriander and finally some herbal notes. I cant keep myself from thinking of a lemon pie. Although I do get pretty much the same flavors, my main complaint is the lemon quickly fades out and is replaced by a huge amount of coriander and cloves. Good balance of tartness provided by the wheat which balances the sweetness. Body is a bit thin. Quite refreshing, drinks easily although the spices are overwhelming to my tastes and the flavors werent as interesting as the nose was promising.

500ml bottle acquired in trade with MartinT (thanks!). Poured a medium, and slightly hazy, golden color with a huge sized, frothy white head. Aromas of yeast, spices, citrus, and some apple & banana fruitiness. Tastes of wheat, citrus, very light spices, and lightly fruity. Sweet finish. Thin body.
Cloudy blond color. Quite ordinary Belgian Wheat, spicy, some sweetness. Pleasant.
Jaune blanche claire, moyen collet. Arome de coriande asser fort. Goût un peu épicé et de blé délicieux, arrière goût plaisant.

Bottle shared with and courtesy of HogTownHarry. Pours a cloudy sparkling yellow-gold with a large diminishing foamy white head. Aroma: WOW! Id be chugging Belgian Wits every day if more of them smelled like this -- SPICY aroma with yeast and citrus --  awesome! Taste is also spicy and unlike many witbiers theres no sign of the (for me) dreaded banana smell and taste which, like HogTownHarry mentions, made me exclaim "Fuck yer banana in the ass!!". Along with the spices theres malt, yeast, some citrus and hops. This Witbier has character and I found it fantastic!!

Bottle (500ml).  Shared with blankboy, my bottle, via trade with turg.  Poured very cloudy light gold with a huge foamy white lasting head.  Sharply yeasty and spicy aroma - black pepper, coriander, herbs, dry floral hops - "yay! no banana", says blankboy, "f**k yer banana in the a**!!!"  Taste is also incredibly spicy, pungent, sharp, bitter, crisp, with lemon zest - but its all about the spices and yeast, some fruity malt and dry hops, but they keep their mouths shut - also a bit soapy.  Mouthfeel is a little watery, spicy, astringent, very lively - this is amazing stuff.  I wish it were summer and we were drinking this on a patio.

(500 ml bottle: Obtained in trade with radiomgb, thanks Jeff!) Hazy, golden body shows several streams of small, slowly-rising carbonation bubbles and is topped by a big, fluffy, white head which slowly subsides in rocky fashion.  Sadly, the appearance just may be the best part of this beer.  Fruity, musty, yeasty, slightly spicy nose isnt especially interesting, but hey, at least it introduces the beer accurately because the flavor is pretty mild and boring as well.  Starts off with a bit of citrus and orange peel, transitioning into more coriander toward the finish.  Only slightly sweet with just a hint of bitterness, but overall, though it doesnt taste bad, theres just not much flavor going on here.  Body is rather thin as well, but the citrus, coriander and lively carbonation keep the palate refreshing.  Kind of disappointing, I was hoping for better.

Hazy milky yellow colored, fine white head. Wheat, yeast and a penetrating note of soap in the aroma, not very pleasant. Fruity flavor mostly peach with some yeasty notes. Foamy mouthfeel. Thin, uninteresting and extremely overrated (like many non-Belgium Belgian White....)!!
Cloudy yellow beer with a white head. Yeasty and spicy aroma with a light citric note. Sweet orange fruity flavor with a yeasty note and a light spicy dry finish.
Bottle. Hazy orange colour with a white head. Aromas of yeast, citrus and spices, coriander. Sweet spicy flavor with hints of yeast and coriander. Has a dry citrus finish.
Bottle. Hazy orange colour with a white head. Light yeasty, citrus, spicy aroma and a sweet perfumed, fruity, spicy taste. Medium body with a sweet light dry finish.

(Bottle 50 cl) Pours a very unclear, pale golden with a small, white and creamy head. Fresh and very spicy nose. Appears quite light-bodied with fresh, citrusy notes and a distinct spiciness. On top of the usual coriander I detect something that suspiciously reminds me of cardamom! Very fresh with a slight touch of sulphur in the finish. 270106

Bottled: Yellow coloured. Hazy. Dense off white head. Sweet and fruity aroma. Yesty and notes of stearin. Flavour is  quite watery. Has a somewhat sour tone. Is citric and yeast with spicy and fruity notes. Ends on a spiced note.
Pours a murky yellow. Fruity and flowery, hint of lavender. Light bodied. Light Spicy finish.

Bottle.
Cloudy yellow coloured with a white head.
Aroma of fruits, citrus and vegetables.
Flavour of fruits, citrus and spices.

An unclear orange beer with a disappearing white head. The aroma is sweet spicy - with coriander standing out, but also fruity notes of oranges. The flavor is also sweet spicy, but here both ginger and coriander are present, as well as notes of oranges.

Bouteille-Une belle dorée un peu trouble avec peu de mousse. Odeur de céréale et dépices. Goût de céréale avec un petit quelque chose dagrumes. Assez faible en bouche. Désaltérant.--Bottle-A pretty golden one with almost no head. Sweet cereal smel and spicy too. Taste of cereal and a little something of orange. Light in mouth. Refreshing.

500 ml bottle courtesy Siroy. Cloudy golden colour with a fully lasting creamy white head. Lots of orange and spice aroma with light lemon notes. Mostly lemon flavour with light spice and a dry wheaty character. Dry refreshing mouthfeel to match a light to medium body. A bit more lemon than I like, but a solid Wit.

[Bottle 500ml, 14c, 1 month old]
A true witbier. Strong coriander amora (too dominant for my taste) + some citrus + some banana. 
Creamy texture. faint floral sweetness on the attack, coriander and citrus development, dry wheaty finish.
500ml bottle.  Forte senteur dagrumes. Gout dagrume modéré. Biere légerement sure mais pas désagréable. couleur jaune doeuf dilué, collet blanc qui descend lentement.
Robe blonde cuivrée surmontée dune mousse blanche imposante. Arômes de coriandre et dorange. Saveurs de coriandre, de curaçao, de blé et de levures.
Hazy golden ale with a thin white head. Wonderful aroma of bananas, orange peels,  and light licorice. In mouth, tingling spices and bananas. Medium bodied, surprising for a blanche. Excellent, Fred!

This is probably my new favourite wit. 

Light white head, floral, spicy nose of bananas and bubblegum. Sweet spicy floral mouth with coriander, bananas and a low hop presence.  The finish very dry with cloves and bananas.  Pick some up today.

bottle. orange, slightly foggy body with a small fizzy white head. aroma is heavily of yeast, sweet fruit, mild spices, and cereal grains. flavour is agressively astringent with bready yeast notes and peppery spice. quenching body but lacking anything memorable. dry finish.

Two out of three are excellent. I have to find a bottle of the Ambree. Excellent spice and banana aroma. Cloudy dark yellow turning to orange. Soft body. Soft banana flavour. On tap on a patio would be awesome.

Bottle: Poured a dark yellow lightly cloudy ale with a huge foamy head with perfect retention. Aroma of coriander is nicely mixed with strong wheat  what a difference from most light witbier that are brewed to try and please the non-beer crowd. Taste is dominated by wheat and reveals a nice coriander/citrus finish. Body is quite full but still provide a refreshing edge. Nice to see somebody trying to put some more character in a style that is bland most of the time.

UPDATED: JUL 5, 2011 Rerate - July 2011.  Very pale hazy straw coloured pour with a thick white head.  The aroma is quite light and wheaty.  There is a lot of kafir lime leaf, coriander and some floral chamomile flavour as well.  A fairly pronounced bit of DMS that I could definitely do without in it.  A bit of band-aid in addition to some fairly honeyish cooling flavour.  Its got a bit of soft spiciness as well but its very different from the first time I had it.  Some interesting stuff but also somewhat diminished.

Pale orange coloured cloudy beer with a massive and persistent foamy head.  Aroma is very perfumy with loads of coriander, orange citrus and a touch of lemon.  Creamy texture with a faint floral sweetness up front, middle of spicy coriander and citrus.  Dry wheaty finish with a hint of orange at the end.  Well-crafted beer.

Aroma:Fruity,wheat
Appearance:Gold amber small head
Flavor:Fruity and spicy

Very nice citrusy orange corander nose.  Maybe a few caramel malts in there.  Unfortunately, the aroma dies quickly, as does the white head.  Body is a milt to moderate hazy honey color.  Too dark, IMO.  Milky, bready, yeastly wit.  I happen to like these characterisitics.  Start has a somewhat citrus and sour start, but turns into a very full-bodied beer to finish.  Not totally to style, but I kind of like this interpretation.

Yeasty slightly spicy aroma with a very slight hint of citrus. Golden yellow body with big fluffy white head. Flavour is fairly mellow with some light spice and yeast. Very slightly on the sweet side. Bit watery at times, the palate is a bit too light. Would not have pegged this one as a wit from the initial taste, more like an abbey blonde or something. The wheatiness is not the dominant flavour by any means.  Nice but I expected better.

Hazy straw color with an airy popcorn white head. Fresh, rolled in the hand mint with a touch of coriander waft to the nose. Gentle and slick on the palate. Marshmallows come to mind, at least the little colored ones - green, Orange and yellow. Enough orange and mint that lamb chops come to mind. More cream comes out as it warms. Very enjoyable wit. Thanks, again, go out to Rastacouere.

water and fizz and a bit of wheat beer. Initial aroma corriander and floral and wheat. Appearance: Beer colour with vanilla added and lots of soapy bubbles in big cream that dissipitates. Bit of banana and astringent aftertaste.
pours w/ a huge head, then settles quckly. clear golden, w/ a tart flavor. lacks the crispness of other wits Ive had

Huge orange coloured head, fast dwindling, above a beer, the perfect colour of apricotskin. Blasts of coriander out of the glass remind me of an industrial kitchen preparing soup. Yeasty, meaty aromas complete the picture. Spicey, leafy, soupy taste, dominated by coriander. Completely unidimensional because of this dominance. The beer-base tries to get from underneath, with some apparently good malt, but its no use. Well-bodied. Slightly oily, nearly fatty mouthfeel. One of the few good things about "witbier" IMO, is that it can be (citrussy) refreshing. No way with this corianderextract. It *has* character - but not one I want to marry.

Medium, creamy white head sustained by strong carbonation. Blonde, slightly cloudy color. Very appealing orange aroma with spices, maybe yeast too. Interesting, refreshing flavors of orange and wheat, its very slightly tart also. Very smooth mouthfeel.
Spicey witte beer. ok. Not a favorite. Lots of orange peel in the aroma. Yellow in color.
UPDATED: MAY 11, 2004 thanks to Lubiere...Yellow with white head. Orange peel aroma. Flavor is malty but with sharp orange peel like flavor.

text: This is easily the best wit I've had out of the bottle. It's surprisingly orange, but the haze is still there. Great aromas of orange, yeast, and spices. The flavors get even more complex, with notes of lemon, coriander, ginger, and black pepper.  It comes back to earth a bit on the palate, as it seems too carbonated and lacks the smoothness that I tend to associate with this style. Still, this is one hell of a beer. Big Time thanks to Lubiere for this one!

Pours a cloudy pale golden with a thick lacy white head.  Bready Belgian yeast aroma has a nice spice profile and malty backbone. Body is smooth and malty with a good balance of coriander and citrus spice.  Finishes dry and mildly bitter with a touch of pepper.  Thanks Rastacouere!

Bottle pours a slightly hazy golden color, moderate fizzy white head that quickly settles to a thin film, abundant carbonation, with virtually no lacing.   Light wheat, very light wheat, along with minor orange, lemon, and yeast notes.   Could stand to be spicier.   Forwardly yeasty and wheaty.   Very little in the way of citrus or witbier like flavors.   Somewhat thin in the middle, both in body and in taste.   Slight yeasty/citrusy flavor before the finish, but its gone before you can begin to appreciate it.   Overall, a bit thin and not as flavorful as I would have liked, but its drinkable.   Thanks goes out to Rastacouere for the trade!

(500ml bottle) Pours a medium, white head and a orangy-gold body. Much like the Triple the nose is of wheat. Flavours of lemon, wheat, oranges and yeast. Very nice. Not as complex as many I've tried but a very strong performer indeed. I look forward to trying this one again!

UPDATED: APR 27, 2004 Re-rate: With full-carbonation, I bumped up the scores for appearance, mouthfeel and overall impression. New sample pours a generous white head atop a deep dark golden body. Head lasts nicely and eventually recedes to cover. Good carbonation. Refreshing, lively mouthfeel.

Original rating 9-3-9-2-16=3.9: Citrus - lemon and orange, coriander, yeast aromas. Deep dark golden honey colour with nice white head that dissipates rather quickly. Flavour is incredible sweet and tart interplay wonderfully - orange, lemon, apple, pear, coriander, chamomile, bready yeast, biscuit, fresh cut straw. Flavour builds nicely as you drink. Fairly full mouthfeel but carbonation is a bit low. I'm hoping the next bottle will have stronger carbonation as the aromas and flavour on this one are absolutely fantastic. Bottle.

An amazing, out of this world witbier! Bright, yeasty herbal (subtle coriander) aroma. Ton of lemongrass balanced by harvested-yesterday wheat. Also notes of rye, thyme, dried pear and oats. Mellow, soft grain, semi-dry finish.

Cloudy honeyed amber. Mountainous white foam with spacious bubbles. Stunning aroma of lemon, herbs, honeydew, and coriander. Light hints of dough and sweet orange peels.  Phenolic, banana esters and airiness highlight the gorgeous hop undertones. Extremely bright and uplifting. Fluffy carbonation with lots of effervescence. Mellow and elegant phenolic notes in the flavor. Honeydew and herbal notes come on strong before the doughy pale malts appear. Noble hops add a touch of juicy sweetness at the back of the throat, countering the esters and agitating the softly spicy hops. Scrubbing effervescence dries out the finish before a late coriander dusting and spicy hop flourish. Endless straw, coriander and waxy yeast flavors accompany the tongue-tickling esters and airy, phenolic belches. Immensely appetizing, and, without question, one of most elegant witbiers on the face of the planet. Youre a saint, Rasta!
user_location: Blue Ridge Mountains, North Carolina, USA

text: UPDATED: MAR 23, 2004 Very cloudy dark orange beer. Nice white head that fades quickly. Strong, fruity and spicy nose. Flavor dominated by citrus but it gets more complex as is it gets warmer. Short bitter final. Interesting unconventional product.

500 ml bottle.  Ridiculously voluminous head tops a bright, nearly clear golden body.  Light yeasty-banana nose, little spice.  On the tongue, much hotter and spicer, pepper and coriander and orange; with a thick body and high carbonation.  Only lightly sweet, very mellow and smooth at the front with heavy acidity later.

Cloudy orange with a bubbly white head. Spicey - coriander and pepper and yeast but not as much banana as some witbiers. Carbonated to the point of being tongue-tingling, but with a smooth finish of citric acidity and bitterness. Not bad.

The grayest wit since John's Generations. Light in body (until the cloudy end) but doesn't look it. The most coriandered wit I've had - this will actualy make your tongue tingle. Pepper, very little banana sweetness (although some white sugar at the close of the sip) or acidity (lemon) -instead just flat out huge pepper and spice and I like it!

text: Murky orange in colour.  Aroma is very spicy, with yeast, oranges and bananas.  Flavour was slightly dry, spicy, with bananas, lemons, oranges and some pepper.  Finish is smooth, mild bitterness, slightly dry.  Very well made but I guess that I am just not a huge fan of this style.

UPDATED: JAN 28, 2005 This is a wild beer. Not your conventional White beer. The color is not truly like a white, it is much too orange to be considered a white. However, at the opening, there is excellent coriander, orange and banana, all typically found in a white. But the real surprise is in the finish. The slower you drink this beer, the better it gets! In the end, the flavors where so good, this beer felt like a dubbel!

Cloudy orange colour, not much head but one heck of a carbonation.  Strong banana, coriander and lemon aroma with a hint of sulphur unfortunately.  A mix of coriander and orange in the flavour, long bready, yeasty finish, some peppery notes.

UPDATED: MAR 2, 2004 typical white beer appearance. I've split the bottle with my mother and she loved it. It looked much hazier in her glass (Blanche de Bruxelles flute) than mine (some kind of 0.2L tumbler mug). Anyway, the head is initially very generous with well laced bubbles, but it swiftly quits the glass to leave just a thin white ring through the tasting. Also, it's the most carbonated witbier I've ever seen. When putting my nose close to it to smell, I actually heard the bubbles bursting like it does with a fresh coca-cola. Needless to say it was surprisingly biting the tongue a bit for a white (not saying that as an unpleasant default, just a remark). The aroma is appealing with heaps of coriander. Very tasty lemon and orange are also part of the meeting like 2 lifetime friends. The mouthfeel is not so full though, one step under Hoegaarden in that department. Typical light acidity complements the sweet and spiced fruitiness to make this a perfect refreshing successful beer.  2nd batch: darker, a little lighter bodied, the same spiced profile I love, but overall, this seems less interesting than last time. Perhaps because it's in the middle of the winter? I'm not changing the score anyhow, maybe this summer

UPDATED: AUG 10, 2014 Amorous coriander, camomile and lemon peel scents an ethereal mouthfeel... Subtle mangoes triumph smoothly within the coriander milk and lively bubbling... Dry, elegant and comforting, the lemon peel biscuit of the Witbier world...
